Change-Id: Ic221a138b23561c48fe8b9516b019fed647f4184

title: Fix aggregation of RH and T values for download
message:
Fix aggregation of RH and T values for download

When downloading logged RH/T values, these do not arrive in pairs,
but independently. Also, they arrive in packets, so several RH values
might arrive before the corresponding T value does. The code to
aggregate these values in pairs did not account for this, losing
three out of four values by overwriting them in the aggregator.

There are now two different aggregation strategies for live and
logged data: for live values, the timestamp is ignored, for historic
values it is not.

Change-Id: I734b54a0a3246d58a306c14dcf5ceda4d70f5d3f

title: SGA-90 Fix ConcurrentModificationException
message:
SGA-90 Fix ConcurrentModificationException

The spurious ConcurrentModificationExceptions stem from not locking
the synchronized objects when iterating over them.
Javadoc makes it quite clear:

"It is imperative that the user manually synchronize on the returned
list when iterating over it"
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Collections.html
 #synchronizedList(java.util.List)
 #synchronizedMap(java.util.Map)
 #synchronizedSet(java.util.Set)

Thus an individual modification (add/remove/..) is synchronized but
the iteration is not! When a modification happens while iterating
an exception will be thrown instead of going into undefined behavior
as is the case without synchronizedLists/Maps/Sets

This commit fixes all such instances in the app

Change-Id: I638ffb02332a833d435d55905233282fd216f3a3

title: Fix crash with onResume / Unbind Butterknife
message:
Fix crash with onResume / Unbind Butterknife

onResume is erroneously called directly from setUserVisibleHint. This
happens before onCreateView was called. This change removes the wrong
custom implementation of setUserVisibleHint in both parentFragment and
parentListFragment.

During onViewDestroyed butterknife should be unbound.
The boilerplate code for unbinding is now brought together in the
two parent*Fragment classes.

This might also solve some issues where the context is not valid
anymore since the view is sometimes recreated

Change-Id: Icd6f9145d7cf2388a42ef7deb38e0904f0a2468b

title: Bunch of minor fixes
message:
Bunch of minor fixes

Change-Id: I9743c9b47f5ec87989c2cbf8b435ae4c10326c86

title: Fix UI update loss on device reconnect
message:
Fix UI update loss on device reconnect

The UI elements are removed when a disconnect happens, sometimes
however, the device comes back and continues sending notifications
which triggered a lot of warnings. This patch adds the UI elements back.

Change-Id: I26cd415e159edb00c42706fbb916c815fa5b4507

title: Fix code susceptible to synchronization issues
message:
Fix code susceptible to synchronization issues

mActiveSensorViews is a synchronized hash map but between a
.containsKey(k) and .get(k) the item could still be removed.
Instead of introducing needless locks, directly attempt to
retrieve the item and check for null.

The code also changes parts where runOnUiThread constructs are
needlessly introduced to call .invalidate and replaces them with
postInvalidate which does virtually the same.

Change-Id: I7200a62224a2a8d85e9d0a4723eec36328f1927c

title: Also cache device name when no name is specified
message:
Also cache device name when no name is specified

This avoids a ton of repeated SQL requests

Change-Id: I0fd64a6365be1eaad2e203c7d537520bf22b8857

title: Fix NullPointerException due to async execution
message:
Fix NullPointerException due to async execution

This fixes a reported crash from PlayStore that happens
when the dialog is dismissed before reaching the UI sync code.

The pointer is checked for nullity before spawning the runOnUI
thread but by the time the thread is started the condition may
not hold anymore resulting in a crash.

title: SGA-66 Cache latest sensor measurement data
message:
SGA-66 Cache latest sensor measurement data

The latest sensor measurement data is stored on the RhtSensorFacade.
When a fragment, or a listener is registered, is automatically
notified of the latest sensor values. Fragments will have immediatly
the latest sensor data and will not have to wait until the Humigadget
devices sends a new notification again.

title: SGA-60: Refactor the 'ScanDeviceFragment'
message:

- Inject XML resources using the Butterknife library
- Inject all views using the Butterknife library
- Annotate some parameters with @NonNull and @Nullable
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a lenght greater than 120
  characters
- Add NullPointerExceptions checks around all the class in order
  to avoid crashes
- Rename XML tags with confusing names

- Refactor the related adapter 'HumigadgetListAdapter'
 * Object Lock synchronization between both ‘clear’ and ‘addAll’ methods
 * Use ButterKnife in order to inflate the elements
 * Add annotation for calling the ‘addAll’ and ‘clear’ methods within an
   UI thread. (Avoid some exceptions, avoiding some possible regressions)

 * Pass the typeface using the constructor
